info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 12:00PM PST until January 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...A wintry mix of moderate to heavy snow, sleet and rain. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 7 inches between 4500 and 5500 feet elevation and 8 to 16 inches above 5500 feet elevation with locally higher amounts over the higher peaks. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Elevations above 4500 feet in south western Siskiyou County. This includes Etna Summit on Sawyers Bar Rd and Scott Mountain Summit along highway 3. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. The heaviest snow will occur through 5 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible due to snow and ice. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
